definition[0]: a record of an amount spent or received, as shown in a companyâ€™s accounting records
example[0]: The company had falsified book entries.
definition[1]: a situation in which the names of owners of bonds, shares etc are held on computer rather than on documents
example[1]: Mutual funds are generally book entry, but certificates are available for investors who want them.
example[2]: The issue will be available in book-entry form only.
